etymology.description: 肖(resemble) + 像(image/figure) = likeness image → portrait.
etymology.interpretation: Combines resemblance with image to denote an image that captures a person’s likeness; chiefly used for portraits of people.

examples.chinese: 这幅肖像很传神(這幅肖像很傳神)。
我买了一幅名人的肖像(我買了一幅名人的肖像)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ mǎi le yī fú míngrén de xiàoxiàng.
examples.english: I bought a portrait of a celebrity.

examples.chinese: 艺术家根据照片创作肖像(藝術家根據照片創作肖像)。
examples.english: The artist creates a portrait based on a photo.
